com.chrismin13.additionsapi.items

Class CustomItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chrismin13.additionsapi.items.CustomItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<CustomItem>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CustomArmor, CustomBow, CustomTexturedItem, CustomTool

    public class CustomItem
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Comparable<CustomItem>
    A Custom Item with multiple values that can be changed.

    If you want Custom Items with Custom Textures, see CustomTexturedItem
    If you want to use this for tools (Sword, Axe, Pickaxe, Shovel, Hoe), use CustomTool instead. There are similar classes available for other ItemTypes too, such as Leather Armor.

    In order to use the Custom Items in-game, you can register them using the AdditionsAPIInitializationEvent. That way, Recipes and Custom Textures will be functional.
    If you want to get an ItemStack for giving it to the player, make a new CustomItemStack and get the ItemStack from there.
    Author:
    chrismin13

        public static final String LORE_PREFIX

      • LORE_SUFFIX

        public static final String LORE_SUFFIX

      • MAIN_HAND_UUID

        public static final UUID MAIN_HAND_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Main Hand Slot. This value is NOT taken from the Minecraft Source Code, but instead I just set it as a random UUID, due to not being able to find what the UUID is in Vanilla Minecraft.

      • OFF_HAND_UUID

        public static final UUID OFF_HAND_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Off Hand Slot. This value is NOT taken from the Minecraft Source Code, but instead I just set it as a random UUID, due to not being able to find what the UUID is in Vanilla Minecraft.

      • HEAD_UUID

        public static final UUID HEAD_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Head Slot. This value is taken straight from the Minecraft Source Code.

      • CHEST_UUID

        public static final UUID CHEST_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Chestplate Slot. This value is taken straight from the Minecraft Source Code.

      • LEGS_UUID

        public static final UUID LEGS_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Leggings Slot. This value is taken straight from the Minecraft Source Code.

      • FEET_UUID

        public static final UUID FEET_UUID
        The UUID of the Attribute that will be applied to the Boots Slot. This value is taken straight from the Minecraft Source Code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomItem

        public CustomItem(org.bukkit.Material material,
                  int amount,
                  short durability,
                  String idName)
        Create a new Custom Item.
        Parameters:
        material - the material of the CustomItem
        amount - the amount of the CustomItem
        durability - the durability of the CustomItem
        idName - the Custom Item's ID Name. This MUST BE SIMILAR to "vanilla_additions:emerald_sword" and is saved in the ItemStack so you can easily detect which Custom Item it is.

      • CustomItem

        public CustomItem(org.bukkit.Material material,
                  int amount,
                  short durability,
                  String idName,
                  ItemDurability itemDurability)
        Create a new Custom Item.
        Parameters:
        material - the material of the CustomItem
        amount - the amount of the CustomItem
        durability - the durability of the CustomItem
        itemDurability - the ItemDurability Durability System that will be used for the Item. This will modify the way that durability drops for the Custom Item. All Classes under package com.chrismin13.additionsapi.durability are valid.
        idName - the Custom Item's ID Name. This MUST BE SIMILAR to "vanilla_additions:emerald_sword" and is saved in the ItemStack so you can easily detect which Custom Item it is.

      • CustomItem

        public CustomItem(org.bukkit.Material material,
                  int amount,
                  short durability,
                  String idName,
                  ItemDurability itemDurability,
                  ItemPermissions itemPermissions)
        Create a new Custom Item.
        Parameters:
        material - the material of the CustomItem
        amount - the amount of the CustomItem
        durability - the durability of the CustomItem
        itemDurability - the ItemDurability Durability System that will be used for the Item. This will modify the way that durability drops for the Custom Item. All Classes under package com.chrismin13.additionsapi.durability are valid.
        idName - the Custom Item's ID Name. This MUST BE SIMILAR to "vanilla_additions:emerald_sword" and is saved in the ItemStack so you can easily detect which Custom Item it is.

        public int getAmount()
        Returns:
        The Amount of the Custom Item

      • getDurability

        public short getDurability()
        Returns:
        The Durability of the Custom Item. This will be the durability of the default texture for a CustomTexturedItem. If the TexturedItem was not processed during the AdditionsAPIInitializationEvent, it will be always 0.

      • setMaterial

        public CustomItem setMaterial(org.bukkit.Material material)
        Set the Material of the Custom Item

      • setAmount

        public CustomItem setAmount(int amount)
        Set the Amount of the Custom Item

      • setDurability

        public CustomItem setDurability(short durabilityShort)
        Set the Durability of the Custom Item. You may not use this method on TexturedItems as it will mess up the durability of the default texture.

      • getItemType

        public ItemType getItemType()

      • isUnbreakable

        public boolean isUnbreakable()
        Returns:
        Boolean that states if the item is unbreakable or not. However, just because the Item is unbreakable doesn't mean that it will not have it's durability reduced as it can have Fake Durability.

      • setUnbreakable

        public CustomItem setUnbreakable(Boolean unbreakable)
        Set the Custom Item to be Unbreakable or not. However, just because you set Item to be unbreakable doesn't mean that it will not have it's durability reduced as it can have Fake Durability.

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName()
        Returns:
        The Display Name of the Custom Item.

      • setDisplayName

        public CustomItem setDisplayName(String displayName)
        Set the display name of the Custom Item. By default, it will add ChatColor.RESET in front to prevent the slanted text. You can override that by adding another ChatColor afterwards, however be aware that it will show up if you rename the item in an anvil.

      • getIdName

        public String getIdName()
        Returns:
        String - the CustomItem's IdName. This has a similar format to the ones found in vanila, e.g. vanilla_additions:emerald_sword, and are saved using an nbt tag in the ItemStack. You can get the IdName from any itemstack by using AdditionsAPI.getIdName or creating a CustomItemStack and getting the idName from there.

      • setIdName

        public CustomItem setIdName(String IdName)
        Set the CustomItem's IdName. This has a similar format to the ones found in vanila, e.g. vanilla_additions:emerald_sword, and are saved using an nbt tag in the ItemStack. You can get the IdName from any itemstack by using AdditionsAPI.getIdName or creating a CustomItemStack and getting the idName from there.

      • getForbidenEnchantments

        public List<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment> getForbidenEnchantments()
        Get a List of the Enchantments that are not allowed for this item. These will be checked when using an Enchantment Table or an Anvil to add Enchantments.

      • addForbiddenEnchantment

        public CustomItem addForbiddenEnchantment(org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment forbiddenEnchantment)
        Add an Enchantment to the list of forbidden enchants. Any Enchantments that are added will not be able to be added to the ItemStack neither from an Enchantment Table, nor from an Anvil.

      • addForbiddenEnchantment

        public CustomItem addForbiddenEnchantment(List<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment> forbiddenEnchantments)
        Add an Enchantment list to the list of forbidden enchants. Any Enchantments that are added will not be able to be added to the ItemStack neither from an Enchantment Table, nor from an Anvil.

      • isEnchantable

        public boolean isEnchantable()
        Returns:
        boolean - If the Item can be Enchanted. If it cannot be enchanted then after choosing an Enchantment in an Enchantment Table or adding a Book in an Anvil, it will not do anything.

      • setEnchantable

        public CustomItem setEnchantable(boolean canBeEnchanted)
        Set if the item can be Enchanted. If it cannot be enchanted then after choosing an Enchantment in an Enchantment Table or adding a Book in an Anvil, it will not do anything.

      • isCombinableInCrafting

        public boolean isCombinableInCrafting()
        Returns:
        boolean - If the Item can be Combined in a Crafting Table. If it cannot be, then adding two of the same items in a Crafting Table will not give any result.

      • setCombinedInCrafting

        public CustomItem setCombinedInCrafting(boolean canBeCombined)
        Set if the item can be Combined in a Crafting Table. If it cannot be, then adding two of the same items in a Crafting Table will not give any result.

      • getCustomRecipes

        public List<CustomRecipe> getCustomRecipes()
        Returns:
        List - Returns a List of CustomShapedRecipes. These recipes behave a lot like the Custom Recipes already found in Bukkit and are converted to that format upon initialization. See CustomShapedRecipe.

      • addCustomRecipe

        public CustomItem addCustomRecipe(CustomRecipe recipe)
        Adds the specified recipe to the list of CustomShapedRecipes. These recipes behave a lot like the Custom Recipes already found in Bukkit and are converted to that format upon initialization. See CustomShapedRecipe.

      • addAllCustomRecipes

        public CustomItem addAllCustomRecipes(List<? extends CustomRecipe> recipes)
        Adds all of the specified recipes to the list of CustomShapedRecipes. These recipes behave a lot like the Custom Recipes already found in Bukkit and are converted to that format upon initialization. See CustomShapedRecipe.

      • addAttribute

        public CustomItem addAttribute(Attributes.AttributeType type,
                               double amount,
                               org.bukkit.inventory.EquipmentSlot slot,
                               Attributes.Operation operation)
        Adds an Attribute to the CustomItem. If you don't know what they do or how they work, check out the Minecraft wiki. The UUID will be the one that is found by default in Minecraft for the specified Slot. The name will be, as a placeholder, TBD (which means To Be Determined).
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute that will be added.
        amount - The amount of the attribute. Can also be a negative value.
        slot - The EquipmentSlot at which the Attribute will be applied. For example, the EquipmentSlot HAND will apply the specified Attribute to the Main Hand only.
        operation - The math operation that will be used for the amount specified.

      • addAttribute

        public CustomItem addAttribute(Attributes.AttributeType type,
                               double amount,
                               org.bukkit.inventory.EquipmentSlot slot,
                               Attributes.Operation operation,
                               UUID uuid)
        Adds an Attribute to the CustomItem. If you don't know what they do or how they work, check out the Minecraft wiki. The name will be, as a placeholder, TBD (which means To Be Determined).
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute that will be added.
        amount - The amount of the attribute. Can also be a negative value.
        slot - The EquipmentSlot at which the Attribute will be applied. For example, the EquipmentSlot HAND will apply the specified Attribute to the Main Hand only.
        operation - The math operation that will be used for the amount specified.
        uuid - The UUID that the Attribute will be saved with in the ItemStack.

      • getAttributes

        public List<Attributes.Attribute> getAttributes()
        Returns:
        List - A list of Attributes that will be included with the Custom Item. If you don't know what they do or how they work, check out the Minecraft wiki.

        public List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag> getItemFlags()

        List - A list of all ItemFlags included in the CustomItem.

      • getAttributeVisibility

        public boolean getAttributeVisibility()
        Returns:
        Boolean of whether the attribute text in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the text is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_Attribute

      • setAttributeVisibility

        public CustomItem setAttributeVisibility(boolean attributeVisibility)
        Set whether the attribute text in the item lore will be visible or not. If it is set true, then the text will be visible. If it is set to be hidden then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_ATTRIBUTES

      • getUnbreakableVisibility

        public boolean getUnbreakableVisibility()
        Returns:
        Boolean of whether the unbreakable tag in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the tag is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_UNBREAKABLE

      • setUnbreakableVisibility

        public CustomItem setUnbreakableVisibility(boolean unbreakableVisibility)
        Set whether the unbreakable tag in the item lore will be visible or not. If it is set true, then the tag will be visible. If it is set to be hidden then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_UNBREAKABLE

      • getCanDestroyVisibility

        public boolean getCanDestroyVisibility()
        Returns:
        Boolean of whether the text that shows which blocks this item can mine in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the tag is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_DESTROYS

      • setCanDestroyVisibility

        public CustomItem setCanDestroyVisibility(boolean canDestroyVisibility)
        Set whether the text that shows which blocks this item can mine in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the tag is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_DESTROYS

        public boolean getEnchantmentVisibility()

        public boolean getPotionEffectsVisibility()
        Returns:
        Boolean of whether the text that shows the potion effect this item will include when consumed in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the tag is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_POTION_EFFECTS

      • setPotionEffectsVisibility

        public CustomItem setPotionEffectsVisibility(boolean potionEffectVisibility)
        Set whether the text that shows the potion effect this item will include when consumed in the item lore is visible or not. If it is true, then the tag is visible. If it is invisible then the CustomItem includes the ItemFlag HIDE_POTION_EFFECTS

      • setFakeDurability

        public CustomItem setFakeDurability(int durability)
        Sets the Durability for the Fake Durability lore. The fake durability lore offers a near perfect recreation of the Minecraft durability mechanics but hidden in the lore. This way, Textured Items that have to be unbreakable can still have durability mechanics.
        Parameters:
        durability - The maximum durability of the CustomItem and the one that it will be starting with. Any number above 0 will enable the fake durability lore. If it is 0 then it will not be enabled.

      • getFakeDurability

        public int getFakeDurability()
        Returns:
        int - The maximum fake durability of the CustomItem. If this is above 0, then the Fake Durability lore is enabled. The fake durability lore offers a near perfect recreation of the Minecraft durability mechanics but hidden in the lore. This way, Textured Items that have to be unbreakable can still have durability mechanics.

      • hasFakeDurability

        public boolean hasFakeDurability()
        Returns:
        boolean - Whether the Custom Item will include the Fake Durability lore or not. If the fake durability above 0, then the Fake Durability lore is enabled. The fake durability lore offers a near perfect recreation of the Minecraft durability mechanics but hidden in the lore. This way, Textured Items that have to be unbreakable can still have durability mechanics.

      • getEnchantmnets

        public HashMap<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment,Integer> getEnchantmnets()
        Returns:
        Map - A map of the Enchantments included in the CustomItem and their level.

      • addEnchantment

        public CustomItem addEnchantment(org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment enchantment,
                                 int level)
        Adds an Enchantment to the CustomItem.
        Parameters:
        enchantment - The Enchantment to add.
        level - The level of the Enchantment. Set this to 1 if the Enchantment doesn't have multiple levels by default.

      • addLoreLine

        public CustomItem addLoreLine(String lore)
        Adds a line to the Lore that will be included with the CustomItem. This will go above the CustomTool's Fake Attack Speed and Attack Damage Lore and the CustomItem's Fake Durability lore.

      • setLore

        public CustomItem setLore(List<String> string)
        Set the lore of the CustomItem. This will go above the CustomTool's Fake Attack Speed and Attack Damage Lore and the CustomItem's Fake Durability lore.

      • getLore

        public List<String> getLore()
        Returns:
        List - The lore of the Custom Item. This does not include the CustomTool's Fake Attack Speed and Attack Damage Lore or the CustomItem's Fake Durability lore.

      • getFullLore

        public List<String> getFullLore(Map<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment,Integer> map,
                                int durability,
                                Attributes attributes)
        Parameters:
        map - The Enchantments that will be taken into consideration when creating the lore. Currently, only the Sharpness Enchantment and its Level have to be taken into consideration.
        durability - The current fake durability that will be added if the CustomItem has fake Durability.
        Returns:
        List - The lore of the Custom Item. This includes the CustomTool's Fake Attack Speed and Attack Damage Lore and the CustomItem's Fake Durability lore that have been customized according to the specified parameters.

        public int compareTo(CustomItem cItem)
        Compare the CustomItems in regards to their durability. Used for generating the Resource Pack.

        compareTo in interface Comparable<CustomItem>

      • getDurabilityMechanics

        public ItemDurability getDurabilityMechanics()
        Returns:
        ItemDurability - The ItemDurability mechanics. These determine how the durability of the CustomItem, both for Fake and real durability, will drop.

      • setDurabilityMechanics

        public CustomItem setDurabilityMechanics(ItemDurability itemDurability)
        These determine how the durability of the CustomItem, both for Fake and real durability, will drop.
        Parameters:
        itemDurability - the itemDurability to set. Every class under the package com.chrismin13.additionsapi.durability is valid.
        Returns:

      • hasHoeAbilities

        public boolean hasHoeAbilities()
        ONLY APPLICABLE FOR HOES
        This is useful if you would like to create a Custom Item with no special abilities. Most people use Diamond Hoes for Custom Items due to their high durability count and their block breaking speed that is the same as the player's hand. However, upon right click they hoe Grass and Dirt along with playing a sound. So, what this does, is it removes both the sound and the ability to hoe.
        Don't forget to also use #addAttribute(AttributeType.ATTACK_DAMAGE, 0.0D, EquipmentSlot.HAND, Operation.ADD_NUMBER) to remove the hoe's extra attack damage and #setAttributeVisibility(false) to remove the Attribute Lore. Attack Speed will be reset as well.
        Returns:
        Whether the CustomItem that is a hoe will keep its ability to till grass and its sounds.

      • setHoeAbilities

        public CustomItem setHoeAbilities(boolean hoeAbilities)
        ONLY APPLICABLE FOR HOES
        This is useful if you would like to create a Custom Item with no special abilities. Most people use Diamond Hoes for Custom Items due to their high durability count and their block breaking speed that is the same as the player's hand. However, upon right click they hoe Grass and Dirt along with playing a sound. So, what this does, is it removes both the sound and the ability to hoe.
        Don't forget to also use #addAttribute(AttributeType.ATTACK_DAMAGE, 0.0D, EquipmentSlot.HAND, Operation.ADD_NUMBER) to remove the hoe's extra attack damage and #setAttributeVisibility(false) to remove the Attribute Lore. Attack Speed will be reset as well.
        Parameters:
        hoeAbilities - Whether the Hoe should keep its abilities or not.

      • getPermissions

        public ItemPermissions getPermissions()
        Returns:
        The Permission System for the Custom Item.

        public void setPermissions(ItemPermissions permissions)
        Set the Permission System for the Custom Item.

        permissions -

      • getBurnTime

        public int getBurnTime()
        Returns:
        The burn time of a Custom Item in ticks when placed in a furnace. This is only compatible with items that can be burnt in a furnace already.

      • setBurnTime

        public CustomItem setBurnTime(int ticks)
        Set the burn time of a Custom Item in ticks when placed in a furnace. This is only compatible with items that can be burnt in a furnace already.
